Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: 558winnie
Reviews.Content: From the airport the hotel is about 30 mins away, around 36 EUR. Less than a 5 minute walk from the metro station and within close distance walk to the Templo de Debod and Palacio Real. The shower drain though was a little slow and the half divider in the shower left the floor all wet. Staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located!”
Reviews.Author: Pilardvm
Reviews.Content: The accommodations were very comfortable. The people working there were so helpful and nice. The shower drain though was a little slow and the half divider in the shower left the floor all wet.

Reviews.Title: “Loved to be there in Muralto”
Reviews.Author: Danish M
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Spain. I was really worried about the quality of services as seen on internet for different hotels. But fortunately my training coordinator at UPM madrid, Spain advised me for hotel Muralto, i booked that hotel and lived there for 6 days and i must say that this hotel is really good in all aspects. So i would recommend all the peoples coming to madrid spain, Go For It....

Reviews.Title: “Muralto ApartoSuites Madrid”
Reviews.Author: LordCroker
Reviews.Content: Used this place twice now and both times I have been very happy with the stay. The customer service is very good and the rooms are spacious and clean. The first visit I asked to move room due to a poor condition bed and noise outside being on the main street. They obliged and moved me to a room to the back of the building which was excellent and the bed was comfortable. 2nd visit I directly requested a similar room and again the staff obliged. Very peaceful! Great location and a convenient carpark albeit a bit tight to manouver with a large car. Overall, very convenient for me and comfortable rooms. booked through Booking.com and for 57€ I feel its good value.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Loyalty”
Reviews.Author: PHPHIL
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Muralto since 1985. First just for quick visits and then for longer term stays. We have seen the building remodeled, the entrance changed, the suites upgraded, but one thing remains the same: It feels like home.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: valeriemcn
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights and enjoyed our stay. It is very close to metro and supermarket. The staff very helpful. Apt. was very clean and kitchen pots and pans with dish detergent available upon request. Our room was very large and comfortable. The only negative is the noise outside, when our windows were open.

Reviews.Title: “A nice suprise”
Reviews.Author: crowies
Reviews.Content: We booked this because we were on a budget but were really pleased with what we saw when we arrived. The location was just a short walk from the tube and as we later found only a short walk from the Gran Via. We were made welcome at reception and offered free wi-fi, which is always a bonus for me. The room was a little dated and the carpet had seen better days, but it was large and had everything we needed for a good nights sleep which was followed up by a really good breakfast, that was included in the incredible price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico!!”
Reviews.Author: aficionada17
Reviews.Content: I chose Aparto Suites Muralto primarily because of its fantastic location, just of the calle Princesa and near the main drag in Madrid of the Gran Via and Puerta del Sol. It also has a metro namely Arguelles which is literally 2 mins from the door of the hotel. I was in Madrid to take a three week course in Espanol and then an exam. I had great practice with all the wonderful staff at the reception, enjoyed chatting to the waitress whilst having a great breakfast .The room was incredibly large, comfortable and very well equipped with bath, shower, bidet etc., It had a small kitchenette with microwave to heat up the delicious spanish food from El Corte Ingles across the road. It was May, so not too hot but the balcony was nice to go out on even if it was on a side street. Negatively the hairdryer could have been stronger and an ironing board would be ideal for long stay clients. I only complained once about the noise in the room above and it was promptly dealt with. Vuelvo otra vez en mayo 2012 y gracias a todo la gestion por el super servicio. Not the cheapest place to stay if you are travelling alone but so secure and so near everything.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a nice out of the way spot in the city”
Reviews.Author: George_CA
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 2 times and thing its very good value for money. Firstly the rooms are a good size and with the kitchen its extremely handy for when you have a baby. Its close enough to pop into town on the tube or by taxi, or you can walk if the weather is good. I like it because its in a nice part of town. Its what I would call really functional, they are really efficient and although they don't have a restaurant, you don't really need it for where you are staying. Madrid has so many restaurants. I would definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, good room, for a good price”
Reviews.Author: SpontaneousTravel09
Reviews.Content: This room is really good value. The location is only a short walk from the metro and a walkable distance to the old part of town. The staff were excellent. We dealt mainly with Roberto who was very helpful and spoke very good English. He also had a great sense of humour and was really good fun. For the price (we got a double for approx 60 euro per night), the room is great. It is true that the cheaper rooms don't have a view nor much light BUT they are quite a good size, have cooking facilities, and are clean. They also have in-room safes that are actually big enough to store a laptop and an SLR camera.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect living option!”
Reviews.Author: IreneBlag
Reviews.Content: Aparto Suites Muralto made our stay in Madrid nice and relaxing. We had a 2-bedroom apartment and found the rooms quite satisfying – spacious, cleaned every day together with changing bed linen. Well-equipped kitchenette, iron and bathroom added comfort; you don/t have to pay monstrous charges for the laundry. The reception service deserves special gratitude; we were made welcome at once. Polite and qualified, the receptionists provided us with any information, made reservations (i.e. for Toledo excursion) and were very helpful. We got the impression that Muralto functions as a well-run mechanism. It’s pleasant too, that the net info about them represents the facts! I’d recommend Muralto apartments to anyone travelling on business or pleasure. Nice location too: close to historical center (plaza de España is within 5 minutes’ walk as well as El Corte Inglés and very quiet at the same time. Tip: It’s not too expensive to travel by taxi in Spain, but if you want to make it cheaper, Ventura Rodriges metro station is only 2 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Two rooms for the price of one”
Reviews.Author: LC42
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night and found it good value. Location is excellent being moments from Arguelles metro just off the main road from the Cortes los Ingles. We stayed in 508 at the corner which has a living room with a sofa bed, spacious bedroom, and even a kitchenette as well as a balcony. We therefore had a room each for the price of one. There's also free wifi and an electronic safe. On the negative side the TV in the living room doesn't work, the ceiling above the toilet area is a bit moldy. I don't know why but the modern looking building next door seems to be a hangout for young people late at night - I was afraid it might be a club but there was no thumping music. The kids made a lot of noise but we were high enough and just shutting the window cut out most of the noise. We walked past in the morning and they seemed to have curiously left the place fairly tidy. Word of warning for parents - they have two channels of adult TV at night. Would definitely stay again next time I'm in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: 33traveller44
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. It is a fair walk to the city centre but we were happy to do this. Efficient staff who are happy to help. Large and spacious rooms with small kitchen. Agree with other reviews that it is noisy - thin walls and street noise from outside. Many shops, supermarket, restaurants an a Starbucks are nearby.

Reviews.Title: “It met our needs... for business and leisure”
Reviews.Author: MCN-Travels
Reviews.Content: We stayed on 3 separate occasions in September. As mentioned by others, it is ideally located in a nice residential/business area. The beautiful Parque del Oeste, El Corte Inglés, grocery stores, cafes, restaurants and the metro are all just a block or two away. I was happy to have the tiny refrigerator and microwave; easy enough to pick up convenience food at the local grocery store and not have to eat all meals out. Staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean but no frills. They varied from small and dark to a large one facing the front of the hotel. The latter had a nice sitting area and plenty of light. On two occasions, the room was very quiet. On one of our stays, however, we could hear every word from the neighboring room (There was a locked, connecting door between the two.) I would stay here again, if business brings us back to Madrid, but I would ask for a room facing the front that does not have a connecting door to other rooms.

Reviews.Title: “First experience of an aparthotel”
Reviews.Author: hollycorner
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. The hotel is on a quiet street about 5 mins from the tube station so really convenient for getting around Madrid. The staff were polite and efficient. The room had a bedroom with en suite bathroom and a lounge area with a sofa bed and unlike other hotels we have stayed in were everything is in one room it was nice that there was more space for 2 six year olds and 2 adults. The room was clean and cleaned daily. The kitchen was tiny with a microwave and hotplate and fridge. No saucepans for using the hotplate, no kettle for boiling water. Its OK if you want to heat things up in a microwave but don't expect that you could cater for cooking for a familiy. We ate out most of the time. We didn't pay extra for the hotel breakfast, I went over to Starbucks every morning and brought back fresh coffee and croissants (much cheaper). There are food stores very near to the hotel so getting bits and pieces wasn't a problem. I felt it was a safe area, didn't see many tramps. Would use aparthotels again.

Reviews.Title: “Great and good location”
Reviews.Author: Pedrinha
Reviews.Content: I was 2 weeks in Muralto and I enjoyed a lot. The room had a little kitchen with micro-waves e fridge nice for coockin. The room's have space and very clean. The location is great, 1 minuto we have metro, taxi, El Corte Inglês, Zara and a lot of pubs, restaurants, shops, very nice for tourism too, because it was 2 metro stations of the center (Puerta del Sol and Gran Via)

Reviews.Title: “What a dump...”
Reviews.Author: DrSavant
Reviews.Content: I've arrived to the hotel rather tired, after a transatlantic flight, not really having any expectations. But... Unfortunately, this place is an overpriced dump. Yes, it's close to Gran Via, however I've stayed on Gran Via for less money in nicer accomodations. There is a kitchen in the room. Yippie. The TV was broken. Well, I don't usually watch TV, however it may be an issue for some people. Sliding closet doors were broken as well. Luckily Samsonite garment bags convert into a hanging wardrobe... The general feel of the room was one of a dirty place. Something like a roach motel. When you pay over 100 Euro per night, you want something a bit better than a roach motel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jennir70
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with big room and big bathroom. Some staff was helpful while others were not. Taxis have difficulty finding this hotel unless you tell them exact address. Walkable distance to Gran Via (shopping street) and Plaza Espana. Provided a small bed for my daughter to sleep on (not the best mattress but it was nice to have).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MexicoCityManuel
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, very large rooms and bathrooms, well decorated. The locations is very good, 1 block from Princesa street, 1 block form El Corte Ingles, 1 block from the metro station, 3 block from Plaza de España. Very close to downtown Madrid, 15 minutes walk. Downtown Madrid is a very crowded and noisy area, so being in a quiet and residential area this close to the center of the city is a plus for me, the hotel is on a quiet street, you could hardly hear any noise at night. The hotel offers free wireless Internet access from any point of the property. We are a family of 5, we stayed in 1 double and 1 triple room, each of them had a little kitchenette equipped with microwave and refrigerator. The pictures I saw on the tripadvisor link was exactly what I found. As a conclusion, this hotel offers great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: KamaLinn
Reviews.Content: We spent one night in this hotel in July. It was our last night during our 3 week trip around Europe. We arrived later than we wanted from Barcelona, so we decided to go to sleep early and get up early to see the sites before we had to fly out in the afternoon. We decided to get up at 6 and we saw the Don Quijote statue and palace before there were any tourists out (around 7;30). The hotel was nice and clean. The front desk was very helpful and multilingual. Ours was a double bed which was 2 twins pushed together (like the rest of Europe). The bathroom was nice and had a tub. These are apartment type rooms, so it was pretty big and had a seperate kitchenette that we didn't use. We weren't sure if the fridge worked because it was open and warm when we arrived. TV had CNN in English. They had WiFi, but we didn't have a laptop. There is an elevator. The only complaint we had was that the room we had was adjoined to another room. There was a locked door between us that wasn't insulated very well. You could hear everything through the door and also a lot in the hallway. We had a group of touring high school students staying next to us that got in around midnight and talked until about 2:00. They didn't get up until we were leaving around 10:00 the next morning. This was horribly annoying, so maybe if you go here, ask to stay far away from the touring groups if you come during the summer. There was no breakfast for us provided by the hotel, but there is a restaurant attached that we could have gone to. The hotel is in an okay area. There were some areas where homeless people slept that were between the hotel and the metro. We got in before it got too dark and we saw a few in the morning when we left. No problems, just mentioning it. This hotel was very close to the metro and El Corte Igles. We had no problems getting around here and enjoyed the hotel. We wish we could have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Good location/choice for families”
Reviews.Author: 888travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights with our 2.5 year old child. We had a big apt. with a separate bedroom, then a lounge/ dining room and separate kitchen. Hotel is in a good location, about 2 mins. walk from Arguelles metro station (good interchange for 3 lines). It took about 30 mins from the airport. Huge dept. store (El Corte Ingles) is very close by and it was handy for provisions - we bought bread, cheese and meats and took them back to our room to eat them. Downsides: this is a little bit away from Central Madrid (ie. Sol area) so restaurants and bars were hidden in the side streets. Hotel was good but catered predominantly for Spanish guests and very little English was spoken. Menu in the hotel café was also in Spanish so involved lots of guess work! The café downstairs was handy for breakfasts. Room size was excellent. However, the kitchen was very ill equipped - there were 2 old knives, 2 old forks and 2 spoons - and 2 cups, 2 plates, 2 saucers. The kitchen had a 2 ring hob - but no pots or pans. What's the point of that?! Therefore you could only use the microwave and could not cook anything. There was no kettle so if you wanted a tea or coffee you had to boil up water in tiny tea cups in the microwave. Also simple things such as no washing-up cloth/scrubber or washing-up liquid - therefore we had to leave our dirty plates in the sink as we had no way of cleaning them. The sofa bed would only be suitable for a child - it was very thin and springy. Would not have been suitable for any adults - unless you wanted a bad back. The only English tv channel we could get was CNN (boring!). There was a tv box but it would not work, so there may have been addlt. channels. All in all, this was a good location. The Cable car is about 5 mins walk at the end of the street - but watch out for the dog poo everywhere, though. If you are travelling with young children, an apt. hotel is a good idea and we welcomed the space and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay in Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: loubella
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 4 nights and 5 days at the Aparto Suites Muralto in Madrid. We had an excellent experienc and we would definitely stay there again. My husband, 15 yr. old daughter and I went to Madrid to visit our 20 yr. old daughter who was studying abroad. The apt. was very clean and simply, but tastefully furnished. Our apt. had 2 twin beds, a small kitchenette with microwave, refrigerator, 2 stovetop burners, sink and cabinets. There was a dining area with round table and chairs, plus a living room area with a pull-out sleeper. There were two large windows and a small balcony. The room comfortably fit the three of us. The best part was the bathroom! The bathroom was huge with two sinks, a large counter, bathtub/shower, closet and shelf space, large mirrors and separate area with toilet/bidet. Hairdryer and iron were provided. This was a large, spacious bathroom that was very clean. The towels were large-sized and very soft. The location of the Aparto Suite Muralto is excellent. Only a block and a half from the Arguelles Metro stop which connects to metros to get anywhere in Madrid. We were easily able to travel to other parts of Madrid to see all of the sites: the palace, museums, parks, old Madrid, etc. Also, the Muralto is located one block away from a major shopping stores (department stores, clothing stores, shoe stores, etc.) and a major supermarket that carries everything including prepared take out food. The Aparto Suite Muralto was an excellent location with a very comfotable, spacious room at a very reasonable price. I highly recommend this hotel/suite.
